snippet: The differences between the European catastrophes and economic crises in the United States are a matter of a stronger union.
abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column contends financial troubles being suffered by Puerto Rico, which has announced it is about to miss a bond payment, are different from those plaguing Greece; says Puerto Rico's ills are byproduct of severe economic downturn exacerbated by external factors, but Puerto Rico's citizens have fared better than Greece's due to its being part of United States fiscal union; holds safety net prevents bad situation from becoming worse, while too much austerity can lead to disaster.
lead_paragraph: The differences between the European catastrophes and economic crises in the United States are a matter of a stronger union.

headline.main: America’s Un-Greek Tragedies in Puerto Rico and Appalachia
